meta.title: Be the Bridge Podcast with Latasha Morrison
meta.description: LATASHA MORRISON is a best-selling and award winning author, bridge-builder, reconciler, and a compelling voice in the fight for racial justice. In 2016, she founded Be the Bridge, a non-profit organization equipping more than 1,000 sub-groups across five countries to serve as ambassadors of racial reconciliation. This podcast is another step is cultivating conversations that will hopefully lead to real change.

episodes.title: Be the Bridge - How It All Began!
episodes.description:
Latasha Morrison and Jennie Allen talk about the beginning of their friendship journey.

To learn more about how the bridge started, purchase the Be the Bridge Book. Be the Bridge Book

You can find a full transcript of this episode on our website: Be The Bridge Blog

episodes.title: Interview with Don and Susan McLaughlin
episodes.description:
Interview with Don and Susan McLaughlin, and Stephen Maxwell, on Don's book "Love First: Ending Hate before It's Too Late" and how they implement BTB groups at their church.

This was a recorded interview from 2018.

episodes.title: Awakening to Whiteness
episodes.description: In this episode, Latasha Morrison speaks with pastor and author Daniel Hill about his abrupt awakening to whiteness at the age of 24 and the implications of being a white man in America. Latasha and Daniel explore the journey expressed through his book White Awake: An honest look at what it means to be white, which walks readers through seven stages of cultural awakening.
